description: Campylobacter species are gram-negative bacilli that have a curved or spiral shape (hence their initial classification as vibrios). Campylobacter jejuni is in a genus of bacteria that is among the most common causes of bacterial infections in humans worldwide. Despite their widespread occurrence, C. jejuni was not understood as a cause of diarrhea in humans until 1957.
name: Campylobacter jejuni Antibodies and Antigens
